qas.question: What is the average population density of Switzerland?
What is the population density of the largest Canton of Graubunden, located in the Alps?
Which half of Switzerland is more mountainous?
Which mountain range does Switzerland extend over on both the north and south sides?

context: Extending across the north and south side of the <a4_0>Alps<a4_0/> in west-central Europe, Switzerland encompasses a great diversity of landscapes and climates on a limited area of <a0_0>41,285 square kilometres (15,940 sq mi)<a0_0/>. The population is about 8 million, resulting in an average population density of around <a1_0>195 people per square kilometre (500/sq mi)<a1_0/>. The more mountainous <a3_0>southern<a3_0/> half of the country is far more sparsely populated than the northern half. In the largest Canton of Graubünden, lying entirely in the Alps, population density falls to <a2_0>27 /km² (70 /sq mi)<a2_0/>.
